meanings.definition: To occupy oneself in a desultory but pleasant manner.
meanings.sent1: She was pottering around the garden, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: He likes pottering in his workshop, fixing old furniture.
meanings.sent3: The cat was pottering aimlessly, chasing imaginary mice.
meanings.sent4: The old man could be found pottering by the river, lost in memories.
meanings.sent5: Pottering through the bookshelves, she found a forgotten treasure.

meanings.definition: To move or go in a casual, unhurried way.
meanings.sent1: The turtle was pottering along the sandy beach, taking its time.
meanings.sent2: They were pottering down the street, enjoying the fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The snail was pottering at its own pace, oblivious to the world.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were pottering across the sky, in no rush to reach their destination.
meanings.sent5: Pottering through the forest, they stumbled upon a hidden waterfall.

meanings.sent1: He was pottering with the engine, trying to fix the car.
meanings.sent2: She spent the afternoon pottering around the house, rearranging furniture.
meanings.sent3: The robot was pottering around the room, bumping into walls.
meanings.sent4: The child was pottering with the toy blocks, building a colorful tower.
meanings.sent5: Pottering in the kitchen, she experimented with new recipes.
